title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
01:04 <tekzilla> has quit  
01:54 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
02:04 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
02:22 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: I'm happy to take the build manager for the week, I just wasn't up when the call went out.  
03:33 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: That's OK, you can take the next week  
03:34 <@cjdelisle> ok I'll put my name on the chart so nobody sells it while I'm sleeping :)  
03:47 <DrLou> has quit  
06:00 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
07:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <vmassol> has quit  
08:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <CIA-102> Thomas Mortagne master \* rbc23ac5 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-archetype/src/main/resources/archetype-resources/pom.xml : Does not make sense to depends on implementation - http://git.io/WTv\_Sg  
08:54 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:18 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r8ac17dc / (2 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Fixed wrong variable name - http://git.io/0n38MA  
09:18 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r8a2d3c4 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ExtensionManagerMacros.xml : XWIKI-7199: Broken dependency links displayed for some core extension dependencies ...  
09:21 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* raad2e85 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-aether/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/aether/internal/AetherExtensionRepository.java : XWIKI-7198: Null extension author displayed for some core extensions ...  
09:26 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r7714430 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ExtensionManagerMacros.xml : [misc] Fixed XHTML validity errors - http://git.io/LCrC-g  
09:30 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Could you look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/21/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionManagerAdminTest/testResolveCore/  
09:38 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: theses test are based on the old UI\*  
09:38 <+tmortagne> which is why they are failing  
09:38 <@sdumitriu> So who updates the tests?  
09:40 <+tmortagne> you didn't planned to write integration test for the new UI ? basically you just need to either replace this one completely with yours or convert it but I guess you are going to have a different organization since you have more sections  
09:41 <+tmortagne> (and that there are not even in the same place)  
09:41 <+tmortagne> so as you want, all I could do it remove it since I have no idea how to make it work with the new UI  
09:51 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r0dcc3c0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/internal/DefaultExtensionSerializer.java : [misc] Fixed a bad line that slipped through - http://git.io/viXz7g  
09:51 <@sdumitriu> OK, I'll look at it  
10:10 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle master \* rd676b7d / (11 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7200: New JobStartedEvent and JobFinishedEvent events - http://git.io/5zH8kg  
10:38 <+sburjan> good morning everyone  
10:53 <+sburjan> Enygma`: are you around ?  
10:53 <+Enygma`> sburjan be back in 45 minutes  
10:53 <+sburjan> ok, talk then  
11:41 <+sburjan> I still get Activity and Workspaces macros with lost PR on a blank XEM, I thought we fixed that  
11:50 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I need to clean a String so that it becomes a valid XML name. Is there any code that does this already (available in Velocity)? Otherwise I'll have to write it myself  
11:59 <+Enygma`> sburjan: that's weird. I did not see that for a long time  
11:59 <+Enygma`> which xem are you testing, snapshot?  
12:01 <+Enygma`> (trying to reproduce)  
12:03 <+sburjan> xwiki-manager-ui-all-3.3-20111128.204822-244.xar  
12:04 <+sburjan> also, it is very redundant to have to re-anem the xar and attach it again to the page. We should do this as we do it on the old XEM, which is able to generate a default template based on what is already imported  
12:06 <+sburjan> because I really don't like this step.... re-arraching the xar again with other name just to provide a default template  
12:06 <+sburjan> wdyt ?  
12:10 <+Enygma`> I`ve already done this  
12:11 <+Enygma`> xwiki-manager-ui-all already has a workspace-template.xar attached to the WorkspaceManager.Install page  
12:11 <+sburjan> when did you commit it ? because I don't have it in yesterday's snapshot  
12:11 <+Enygma`> so when you first open XEM, the homepage will say that you need admin rights  
12:11 <+Enygma`> and once you login as admin  
12:11 <+Enygma`> the template is installed  
12:12 <+Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/aad4b9e317a98b46009151611041f73128ccc81f  
12:13 <+Enygma`> get the latest snapshot  
12:14 <+Enygma`> I`m testing now with xwiki-manager-ui-all-3.3-20111129.102457-246.xar      29-Nov-2011 11:25  3.2M  
12:23 <+Enygma`> yes, I see some macro problems, but on a workspace, not on the main wiki Homepage. The problematic macros are Spaces and Tags.. but that's probably because of the page's last author that shows up as the local admin.  
12:25 <+Enygma`> seems that some pages on the xe template have XWiki.Admin as author instead of xwiki:XWiki.Admin  
12:28 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: the solution for subwiki macro registration was to set xwiki:XWiki.Admin as author for XE pages requiring PR?  
12:32 <+Enygma`> if so, then we did not get them all, since macros like Spaces and Tags are still problematic  
13:15 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I got them on main wiki page .. on Activity and Workspace macros. I am hunting something else now, but I will test on the latest snapshot to see if they reproduce  
13:29 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hi. I've noticed we have a CancelableEvent class with a isCanceled() method. Personally I've always written Cancelled with 2 "L" and I'd write Cancelable with 2 "L" too. Are "cancelable" and "isCanceled" ok too?  
13:30 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <@cjdelisle> I had to look that one up, it seems it is a matter of opinion.  
13:39 <@cjdelisle> http://www.oes.org/page2/11255~Cancelled\_or\_Canceled.html  
13:40 <vmassol> yeah I checked on the web and couldn't find a definite answer  
13:40 <vmassol> (I was surprised since I've never heard with single L)  
13:40 <@cjdelisle> I haven't seen it with a single L either.  
13:41 <vmassol> in any case since it seems one L exists I won't change what we have (even though it bothers me when I read it ;))  
13:41 <vmassol> thanks  
13:47 <@cjdelisle> sure thing  
13:57 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I still get the macros errors  
14:17 <+sburjan> and also, in WorkspaceManager/Install I have a workspace-template.xar attached , but it seems to be a wrong xar, because it has only has 989 kb instead of 3.2 mb  
14:17 <+sburjan> so something is definetly not good  
14:18 <+sburjan> that xar doesn't have nothing related to manager inside it...  
14:24 <+sburjan> I am going to report the Macros, and wait for you to confirm the XAR issue  
14:27 <CIA-102> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r214c2fe / (4 files): XWIKI-7190: Create the AppWithinMinutes wizard ...  
15:08 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: we have wiki macro which require PR in XE ?  
15:09 <+tmortagne> does not seems very right to me as for any page in XE that would require PR  
15:09 <+tmortagne> except for very specific pages not about UI like extension manager  
15:10 <+tmortagne> make sure these macro are registered for the wiki and not the farm  
15:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: FYI I'm installing a performance plugin on jenkins, just want to play a bit with it to see if it could be useful for us  
15:19 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r68a334e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-rendering/xwiki-platform-rendering-macros/xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-script/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/macro/script/NestedScriptMacroValidatorListener.java : Removed unnecessary javadocs + removed deprecation usage - http://git.io/-ZcJZA  
15:30 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: don't mix wiki macro registration which should never require PR in XR and wiki macro content requiring PR which has nothing special since it's the right is tested when the macro is executed like for any other page which require PR  
15:31 <+tmortagne> s/XR/XE/  
15:31 <+tmortagne> as for the xwiki:XWiki.Admin in xar in don't know much about it, it has been done by sdumitriu AFAIK  
15:32 <+tmortagne> and again it should not have annything to do with wiki macros  
15:46 <vmassol> guys I've added performance trends to our jenkins instance for ui functional tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/performance/?  
15:46 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/performance/  
15:46 <vmassol> the idea is to see how perf evolves  
15:49 <vmassol> there's a problem of agents though… since they don't all have the same power….  
15:49 <+sburjan> tmortagne: are you talking about the issue I reported ?  
15:49 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no idea, answering Enygma` question  
15:49 <+sburjan> XWIKI-7203  
15:49 <vmassol> updating jenkins now  
15:51 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I don't have time to look at this but wiki macro don't need PR to be registered unless they are register to the whole farm which should never happen in XE  
15:52 <+tmortagne> and wiki macro is executed with the right of its document so if the wiki macro does not have PR it mean the document does not have PR  
15:52 <+sburjan> this is a XEM issue  
15:52 <vmassol> (said differently all wiki macros bundled in XE must have "wiki" as visibility)  
15:52 <+tmortagne> so it should not have anything to do with the fact that it's wiki macros  
15:57 <cjdelisle> has quit  
15:58 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r3bcb672 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-observation/xwiki-commons-observation-local/src/main/java/org/xwiki/observation/internal/DefaultObservationManager.java : Added some javadoc/explanations + renamed some private methods + improved some logging - http://git.io/KDRK-w  
16:16 <+sburjan> guys, we have some serious PR issues on XEM. I am not able to edit WYSIWYG settings on XEM: This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by XWikiPreferences who doesn't have permission to edit this page.  
16:17 <+sburjan> Annotations are also broken, so I guess the apps have this issue on xem  
16:22 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r36634a9 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-observation/xwiki-commons-observation-local/src/main/java/org/xwiki/observation/internal/DefaultObservationManager.java : Slightly improve the error message - http://git.io/u8j24w  
16:25 <+tmortagne> having "XWikiPreferences" as author of a page and way more serious that a PR issue  
16:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan  
16:25 <+tmortagne> s/and/is:  
16:26 <+sburjan> ok, well, should I check if I can reproduce on 3.3 M2, and if yes, report it ?  
16:26 <+tmortagne> either this message itself is bugged or there is something very wrong  
16:26 <+tmortagne> no idea, I don't really know what this message is supposed to be about  
16:28 <+sburjan> i know it's very wrong... I am trying to test workspaces ..and I get in a lot of troubles on XEM  
16:30 <vmassol> fyi jenkins + pugins updated to latest versions  
16:38 <+sburjan> tmortagne: it's also present  
16:39 <+sburjan> in 3.3 M3  
16:39 <+sburjan> \*M2. So I am going to report that as a blocker  
16:39 <+tmortagne> sburjan: ok  
16:41 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r7cfeb04 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-logging/xwiki-commons-logging-logback/src/main/java/org/xwiki/logging/logback/internal/LogbackEventGenerator.java : Added javadoc - http://git.io/fseT3w  
16:46 <vmassol> didn't know agrgegated test results, sounds cool: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1102/aggregatedTestReport/  
16:47 <vmassol> hmmm strange error: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1102/console  
16:47 <+sburjan> tmortagne: should I report it under platform or XWiki Manager ? because the admin app is affected .. so I don't know where to report it  
16:49 <vmassol> Enygma`: the issue seems to be on:  
16:49 <vmassol> [INFO] XWiki Platform - Workspace - UI ................... FAILURE [1.876s]  
16:49 <vmassol> anything you might have modified? any idea?  
16:49 <+tmortagne> sburjan: there is pretty much nothing in XWiki Manager so it's probably a platform issue  
16:50 <+tmortagne> unless you find a graphical bug on XEM home page or things like missing dependencies/pages it's usually a platform issue  
16:50 <vmassol> apparently it's the attachMojo our our maven plugin that's triggering the issue  
16:50 <+tmortagne> XEM it's nothing but packaging or thing commins form platform  
16:51 <vmassol> because of:  
16:51 <vmassol> Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: JAR entry META-INF/components.txt not found in /home/hudsonagent/.m2/repository/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-properties/3.3-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-properties-3.3-SNAPSHOT.jar  
16:51 <vmassol> that's strange  
16:51 <vmassol> I didn't think we would throw an exception if components.txt cannot be found  
16:52 <vmassol> actually seems like the components.txt is found but cannot be read  
16:53 <vmassol> only thing that comes to mind would be a corrupted xwiki-commons-properties-3.3-SNAPSHOT.jar  
16:54 <vmassol> let's see if the next build has the issue  
16:54 <vmassol> sdumitriu: seems you have orphaned pages: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-xmlrpc/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-xmlrpc/692/testReport/  
16:55 <+Enygma`> vmassol: that's the xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin maven plugin trying to attach a xar to a page  
16:55 <+Enygma`> the component manager failed for some reason  
16:56 <+Enygma`> I`ve seen that once before, but on a rebuild it does not show again  
16:56 <+Enygma`> sburjan I tried to reproduce XWIKI-7203 4 hours ago and everything was fine. The macros on the main page were ok.  
16:58 <+Enygma`> sburjan: the workspace-template.xar that is attached to WorkspaceManager.Install is a default XEM xar. It is not the wrong xar and 900k is the correct size of the XE xar.  
17:00 <+sburjan> Enygma`: in this case, something is wrong  
17:00 <+sburjan> because I still get the null error  
17:01 <+Enygma`> when you open Main.WebHome as Admin?  
17:02 <+sburjan> I only manage to make it to work if I rename  xwiki-manager-ui-all-3.3-20111129.102457-246.xar to workspace-template.xar and re-attach it to WorkspaceManager.Install page  
17:02 <+sburjan> the null error is on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Install  
17:02 <+sburjan> I can open my wiki so you can see it for yourself  
17:03 <+Enygma`> sure  
17:04 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r191515c / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-logging/xwiki-commons-logging-logback/src/main/java/org/xwiki/logging/logback/internal/LogbackEventGenerator.java : Small fix to javadoc - http://git.io/9bw-2w  
17:04 <+Enygma`> but sburjan, the idea of the workspace-template.xar is not to put the content of the main wiki on every workspace. The template is supposed to be made up of just the default XE xar.  
17:05 <+Enygma`> xwiki-manager-ui-all contains the wiki manager xar and workspace xar which are not relevant for workspaces (subwikis).  
17:08 <+sburjan> Enygma`: http://82.208.141.83:20200/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
17:10 <+Enygma`> sburjan, that's weird. 1st thing, the translations and suggestion messages should go away after they are installed, not show up every time like they do.  
17:11 <+sburjan> well.. that's not the issue. I am waiting to test Workspaces and I keep having these rights/instalation issues  
17:12 <+sburjan> they are blocking me from testing  
17:12 <+Enygma`> sburjan how did you end up with WorkspaceManager.Install being last edited by "" ?  
17:12 <+Enygma`> that`s the issue here. It does not have PR  
17:12 <+Enygma`> because the last editor is messed up  
17:13 <+sburjan> I didn't touched anything  
17:13 <+sburjan> setup MySQL + started XEM + imported ui-all.xar  
17:13 <+sburjan> that's all  
17:13 <+Enygma`> maybe something went wrong in your import of ui-all.xar  
17:14 <+sburjan> tried this 5+ times today. I am going to clear everything and start from 0  
17:14 <+Enygma`> please close XEM, drop database xwiki; and restart xem  
17:14 <+sburjan> ok  
17:14 <+sburjan> closing  
17:14 <+Enygma`> also drop database workspacetemplate; if it exists  
17:14 <+Enygma`> I`ll try to to the imporing remotely after you restart XEM  
17:17 <+sburjan> Enygma`: http://82.208.141.83:20200/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ .. it's all yours  
17:23 <+Enygma`> ok sburjan  
17:29 <+Enygma`> vmassol: I don`t know what is happening with xwiki-platform and why the xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin keeps failing  
17:29 <+Enygma`> I don`t know if it's related to the code since it started to fail out of the sudden  
17:29 <+Enygma`> I`ve quickly checked agent-6 in the local repository and the xwiki-commons-properties-3.3-SNAPSHOT.jar seems to be there with components.txt  
17:31 <+Enygma`> sburjan: the XEM install went smooth  
17:31 <+Enygma`> and the template is reporting that it's installed correctly  
17:31 <+Enygma`> maybe the xar that you have downloaded and imported had some issues  
17:31 <+Enygma`> I don`t know  
17:31 <+Enygma`> I`ve just imported the same 246 xar as you did  
17:34 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <+sburjan> ok, now  
17:42 <+sburjan> Enygma`: very odd, you also had no macro issues. You can try, I have restarted the wiki  
17:49 <+Enygma`> sburjan, please edit xwiki.cfg and set usepath to 1  
17:49 <+Enygma`> (make sure to remove the # in front of it)  
17:50 <+Enygma`> then please restart xem  
17:50 <+Enygma`> it's still usepath=0 right now.  
18:17 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:18 <+sburjan> removed it  
18:18 <+sburjan> xwiki.virtual.usepath=1  
18:18 <+sburjan> try again  
18:18 <+sburjan> it should work  
18:19 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Did you find the answer to the "clean string for xml name" question?  
18:20 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I did this https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/214c2fe40bdf922554c494538c5fc6c047fd2e5d#diff-1  
18:20 <+mflorea> as a quick solution  
18:21 <+sburjan> Enygma`: try now please  
18:23 <+Enygma`> sburjan, ok  
18:23 <+sburjan> I see a test workspace there  
18:23 <+sburjan> but yes, I am unable to access it  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Looks good  
18:26 <+mflorea> great, thanks!  
18:29 <+Enygma`> sburjan usePath is still set to 0 http://82.208.141.83:20200/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Test  
18:30 <+sburjan> xwiki.virtual.usepath=1 this is what I have in xwiki.cfg. no # before the line  
18:30 <+sburjan> I will erase everything tomorrow and start from scratch  
18:30 <+sburjan> but I still don't get it  
18:31 <+sburjan> are you sure your script is ok ?  
18:32 <+sburjan> I can call xwiki.virtual.usepath = $xwiki.xWiki.Param('xwiki.virtual.usepath', '3') and get 3  
18:32 <+sburjan> :)  
18:33 <+Enygma`> yes, the second parameter of Param(...) is the default value to get in case the requested value is not set  
18:33 <+Enygma`> for xwiki.virtual.usepath default is 0  
18:33 <+sburjan> but yes, the URL of Test1 and Test2 is not ok, even if my xwiki.cfg is correctly set  
18:33 <+sburjan> I will continue investigating tomorrow  
18:34 <+Enygma`> ok...  
18:36 <+Enygma`> by tomorrow you will have a xem distribution that has usePath=1 by default anyway :P  
18:36 <+sburjan> I am running one last test now  
18:36 <+sburjan> to see if at least the XAR import works  
18:37 <+Enygma`> ok  
18:37 <+Enygma`> please try to redownload it  
18:37 <+sburjan> I'm getting on my nerves  
18:37 <+sburjan> I am redownloading everything  
18:37 <+Enygma`> no, just the xar  
18:37 <+Enygma`> since it worked for me  
18:37 <+sburjan> I am able tu setup a XEM in 5 minutes, and I wasn't able to properly setup a newer XEM in2 days  
18:40 <+sburjan> I am downloading http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-jetty-mysql/3.3-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-manager-jetty-mysql-3.3-20111129.173534-156.zip and http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-ui-all/3.3-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-manager-ui-all-3.3-20111129.173601-250.xar  
18:40 <+sburjan> am I correct ?  
18:43 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
18:44 <+Enygma`> yes, that should be good  
18:45 <+sburjan> uploading XAR  
18:46 <+sburjan> getting the trillion console messages about  translations  
18:48 <+Enygma`> ignore that  
18:50 <+sburjan> yes, worked now. but I think it took 4 minutes loading the Main.WebHome for the first time :)  
18:51 <+sburjan> ok, virtual path works now  
18:52 <+sburjan> something was wrong in yesterday and monday's build  
18:52 <+Enygma`> could be  
18:52 <+Enygma`> yes, first access of the homepage is creating the template wiki  
18:52 <+Enygma`> so it takes a while
